intro: Stevia hoppii, commonly known as the "Peruvian stevia," is a perennial shrub native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is known for its high concentration of steviol glycosides, which are natural sweeteners. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Due to its medicinal and commercial value, it is widely used in herbal remedies and as a natural sweetener alternative.
